title: Germany defender Kevin Grosskreutz left with gruesome injuries after being attacked on night out
text:
Sport Germany defender Kevin Grosskreutz left with gruesome injuries after being attacked on night out The Stuttgart stopper received emergency medical attention in hospital and wants to press charges on his attackers, aged between 16 and 19 Share Grosskreutz was left with gruesome injuries (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get football   
Germany defender Kevin Grosskreutz has been left with gruesome injuries after being attacked on a night out. 
The Stuttgart stopper, 28, was left bloodied and bruised after being set upon after leaving a nightclub at around 2.15am, according to reports in Germany, being punched and hitting his head on the pavement. 
His four attackers are all aged between 16 and 19 and were caught by police following the incident. 
A statement from Stuttgart read: “Kevin Grosskreutz was, according to our current knowledge, involved in a physical conflict in the night from Monday to Tuesday and taken to a hospital in Stuttgart. Grosskreutz is currently playing for Stuttgart (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Grosskreutz with Lukas Podolski playing for Germany (Photo: Bongarts) 
“Kevin Grosskreutz is doing well in the circumstances. 
“In all likelihood, he can leave the hospital again on Wednesday. Kevin Grosskreutz will report after the incident.” 
Grosskreutz wants to press charges against his attackers. Grosskreutz in action for Stuttgart (Photo: Getty Images Europe) The defender playing for Germany (Photo: Bongarts) Read More Arsenal star Mesut Ozil reveals how Pep Guardiola's behaviour put him off a move to Barcelona 
The former Borussia Dortmund man was part of Germany's 2014 World Cup triumph. 
He started his career with Dortmund before moving to Galatasaray in September 2015 and on to Stuttgart the following January. Like us on Facebook
